theory_metadata.theoretical_tradition: Social psychology, attitude consistency, cognitive balance
theory_metadata.original_purpose: Explain how people strive for consistency in their attitudes toward objects and other people through balanced triadic relationships

telos.primary_purpose: Predict attitude change and relationship dynamics through analysis of balanced/imbalanced triadic configurations
secondary_purposes: Predict attitude change directions to restore balance
telos.theoretical_scope: Individual-level attitude consistency in interpersonal contexts
telos.domain_applicability: Opinion statements, relationship descriptions, attitude expressions, persuasion contexts

classification.tier_justification: Predicts specific attitude changes and relationship outcomes based on balance/imbalance patterns

persons.definition: Individual actors in triadic relationships (P = perceiver, O = other person)

objects.definition: Attitude objects, issues, or entities toward which attitudes are held

relationships.definition: Directed evaluative connections between persons and objects or between persons

balance_principles.balanced_triad: Product of all three relationship signs is positive (+1)
balance_principles.imbalanced_triad: Product of all three relationship signs is negative (-1)
balance_principles.balance_rule: Friend of friend is friend, enemy of enemy is friend, friend of enemy is enemy, enemy of friend is enemy

structural_measures.balance_coefficient: Proportion of balanced triads in total triadic configuration
structural_measures.tension_index: Measure of psychological tension from imbalanced relationships
structural_measures.change_pressure: Direction and intensity of pressure for attitude change

step_1_applicability_assessment.description: Evaluate text suitability for balance theory analysis

criteria.evaluative_content: Expressions of liking/disliking, support/opposition, positive/negative attitudes
criteria.relationship_clarity: Explicit or clearly inferable relationships between entities

step_1_applicability_assessment.scoring: 0.0-1.0 scale based on presence and clarity of triadic structures

step_2_entity_identification.description: Identify all persons and attitude objects in the text
object_extraction: Identify attitude objects (policies, ideas, groups, behaviors)
Extract abstract concepts toward which attitudes are expressed
Categorize objects by domain (political, social, economic, etc.)
step_2_entity_identification.output_format: person_list: [P, O1, O2...], object_list: [X, Y, Z...]

step_3_relationship_extraction.description: Extract sentiment and unit relationships between all entity pairs
sentiment_relationships: Identify expressions of liking/disliking between persons
unit_relationships: Identify belonging, association, or ownership relations
Extract advocacy, support, or representation relationships

step_4_triadic_configuration.description: Construct all possible triadic relationships from identified entities
step_4_triadic_configuration.triad_notation: POX, PXY, PO1O2 with relationship signs
step_4_triadic_configuration.completeness_check: Ensure all meaningful triadic combinations identified

step_5_balance_calculation.description: Calculate balance/imbalance for each triad and overall configuration

step_1_balance_pattern_analysis.description: Analyze overall balance/imbalance patterns and their implications

step_2_tension_source_identification.description: Pinpoint specific relationships creating imbalance and psychological tension
tension_analysis: Identify relationships involved in multiple imbalanced triads
Assess magnitude of tension from each imbalanced configuration
Prioritize tension sources by psychological pressure

step_3_change_prediction.description: Predict likely attitude changes to restore balance
prediction_logic: Identify minimum changes needed for balance restoration
Consider resistance to change for different relationship types
Assess feasibility of different balance restoration routes

step_4_persuasion_implications.description: Analyze persuasion opportunities and resistance patterns
persuasion_analysis: Identify leverage points for attitude change
Assess optimal persuasion strategies based on balance dynamics

internal_consistency.relationship_coherence: All relationships properly categorized as sentiment or unit

theoretical_fidelity.heider_principle_compliance: Strict adherence to original balance theory principles
theoretical_fidelity.cognitive_consistency_emphasis: Focus on psychological tension and consistency motivation
theoretical_fidelity.prediction_logic: Change predictions follow balance restoration logic

empirical_validation.relationship_identification_accuracy: All explicit and clearly implicit relationships captured
empirical_validation.tension_measurement: Valid assessment of psychological pressure magnitudes

predictive_validation.attitude_change_prediction: Specific, testable predictions about attitude changes
predictive_validation.temporal_dynamics: Realistic timelines for balance restoration processes
